statements.name: PROC SMCALIB
statements.help:
PROC SMCALIB  NAME=libref.data-table<options>;                 
	OUTPUT <options>;                 
	PROJECT  ID=project-ID;                 
	STORE libref.data-table;

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data table (project repository) that contains the projects to be calibrated

arguments.name: MAXOBS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of observations to retrieve for plotting

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads to use in the computation

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: generates output tables that show the project calibration results

arguments.name: HOLDOUTFIT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data table in which to store the holdout forecast values and the {library} in which to store the data table

arguments.name: MODELFIT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data table in which to store fitted values for each model within each project that is calibrated and the {library} in which to store the data table

arguments.name: SCOREINFO=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data table in which to store model-specific score information in human-readable format and the {library} in which to store the data table

statements.name: PROJECT
statements.description: specifies which project IDs from the current project repository are to be calibrated
statements.help: PROJECT  ID=*project-ID*;                                              PROJECT  ID=(*project-ID-list*)                     PROJECT  ID=_ALL_

statements.name: STORE
statements.description: specifies a binary scoring repository in which to store scoring information for each model that is needed by the SMSCORE procedure
